message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this unique opportunity to purchase a high-end product that I think you'll really appreciate. I'm thinking of a price of $20000 for it. What do you think?
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $6000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob, but I'm afraid $6000 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $14000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit far apart. I'd be willing to go up to $7000 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I'm glad you're willing to meet me at $7000, Bob, but I still think the product is worth more than that. I'm willing to compromise at $16000. What do you think?
I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle, Alice. I'm willing to go up to $6500 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I understand your concerns, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable going below $16000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target. How about we meet at $15500?

I'm getting a bit frustrated, Alice. I've already made several concessions and I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'll offer $6000 for the product one last time. If not, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand you're frustrated, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $6000. I'm making one final offer to you: $16250. If you're not interested, I'll have to explore other options. This is my last offer.
I appreciate your final offer, Alice, but I'm afraid I've already decided to explore other options. I'll give you one last chance to meet me at $6000. If not, I'll have to walk away.
